reviews.review: Challenge mode can KISS MY ASS
Increasingly difficult series of puzzles/challenges. Mostly mental - not particularly violent. Suitable (if not great) for pre-teens (you do end up knocking robots over at some point.) A great game!

Short, sweet, charming, entertaining, mysterious, and at times challenging. Such a perfect game that deserves the cultural relevance and gaming community praise it has received. There's really no reason to not purchase this. Worth the full price all day. But if you need extra convincing, it usually drops below 3 bucks on every single Steam sale. Add this to your wishlist and wait for the first sale. Plenty of enjoyment to be had. Also looks great after all these years, too.

sta bueno recomendado esta corto pero si vale la pena â¤ğŸ‘

Story: 10/10. I felt instantly encapsulated when I awoke in my testing chamber room. Instantly, I felt like I was able to percieve this game world's eerily quiet, cyber, potentially post-apocalyptic atmosphere. This is really just the magic of Source engine games.

Game length: just perfect. I feel like this was just perfect for playing on a gloomy, rainy night. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're *inside* the game at times. The puzzles that you're presented with give you an urge to just.. find out more about the story of this game.

Sound effects: amazing. From the voiceover of GlaDOS, to the long, echoing hallways, to the eerie room soundtracks, to the radio in the starting room, to the unsturdy metal foor beneath you cracking and breaking. Again, it is a masterpiece of art and effect.

Small criticism: At times, it did feel like the puzzles were seemingly unsolvable (not just when GlaDOS told you they were unsolvable.) There was just a lack of information on really what to do, and where to go at some later points in the game. I'd just sit there and think, "Now where?" I percieve this is both good and bad, in that it makes you have to think more about what to do next, and where to fire your portals, but at the same time can be seen as discouraging for those who cannot sense what to do.

General rating: 9.5/10. The only reason why it's not a 10/10 is because nothing in this universe is perfect, ever. Generally, if you can get the Portal 1 & 2 bundle, I'd go for it. Try it out, even just play through the first level. If you're like me, you'll get lost in the game's utterly beautiful stature, and just play the day away.
